Line 16: Line 16:
The '''2011 Bahraini protests''' are a series of demonstrations in the [[Persian Gulf]] country of [[Bahrain]]. Part of the [[2010-2011 Middle East and North Africa protests|2010â2011 Arab world protests]], the Bahraini protests were initially aimed at achieving greater [[political freedom]] and equality for the [[Shia]] population,<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/wikileaks-files/bahrain-wikileaks-cables/8334600/BAHRAINS-SHIA-POLITICAL-LEADERS-VISIT-IRAQ.html Bahrain Shi leaders visit Iraq] Daily Telegraph. retrieved 20th Jan 2011</ref><ref name="JazeeraBah14Feb" /> and expanded to a call to end the [[King of Bahrain|monarchy]]<ref name="guard_downwiththeking" /> following a deadly night raid on 17 February against protesters at [[Pearl Roundabout]] in [[Manama]].<ref name="aljaz_bahr17Feb" /><ref name="bbc231injured" /> Protesters in Manama camped out for days at the Pearl Roundabout, that functions as the centre point of protests there.
The '''2011 Bahraini protests''' are a series of demonstrations in the [[Persian Gulf]] country of [[Bahrain]]. Part of the [[2010-2011 Middle East and North Africa protests|2010â2011 Arab world protests]], the Bahraini protests were initially aimed at achieving greater [[political freedom]] and equality for the [[Shia]] population,<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/wikileaks-files/bahrain-wikileaks-cables/8334600/BAHRAINS-SHIA-POLITICAL-LEADERS-VISIT-IRAQ.html Bahrain Shi leaders visit Iraq] Daily Telegraph. retrieved 20th Jan 2011</ref><ref name="JazeeraBah14Feb" /> and expanded to a call to end the [[King of Bahrain|monarchy]]<ref name="guard_downwiththeking" /> following a deadly night raid on 17 February against protesters at [[Pearl Roundabout]] in [[Manama]].<ref name="aljaz_bahr17Feb" /><ref name="bbc231injured" /> Protesters in Manama camped out for days at the Pearl Roundabout, that functions as the centre point of protests there.
